alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 10 at 4:21PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions due to blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Strong winds could cause significant drifting of snow on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northeast winds will intensify into the evening and overnight hours before diminishing early Monday morning. The strong winds will lift easily transportable snow already on the ground leading to ground blizzard conditions.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
